abstract: Treatment with anti-EGFR monoclonal antibodies has been successfully integrated in the continuum of care for metastatic colorectal cancer. The major challenge is the identification of patients who would benefit from treatment. Currently, the best predictor of efficacy is the absence of mutations in KRAS and NRAS genes. title: Optimizing Anti-EGFR Therapy in Colorectal Cancer.
